Bit rate

For cards supporting multiple bit rates, set the bit rate in Mb/s. The bit rate is the speed at which bits are transmitted over the medium. The user speed of the link is lower due to medium sharing and various overhead.

Use auto / best to select automatic bit rate mode (fallback to lower rate on noisy channels), which is the default for most cards. Use fixed and a value to lock the card to a particular bit rate. If you specify auto and a specific rate, the driver will use all bit rates lower and equal than this value.

Examples:

  • iwconfig eth0 rate 11M
  • iwconfig eth0 rate auto
  • iwconfig eth0 rate 5.5M auto
